abstract: David Gelles Revalued column says Microsoft's business units are charged internal tax by company based on their energy usage; money goes into fund investing in environmental sustainability projects; program is at forefront of quickly-expanding effort called carbon pricing.
lead_paragraph: A mixture of moral conviction, economic forecasting and expectations of tougher regulations has spurred Microsoft and others to track their energy use.
